meta.description: British Airways Galleries First Lounge at London Heathrow Airport (LHR), Terminal 3. Learn more about the lounge: amenities, photos, review, opening hours, location.

location.terminalDirections: Zone F, located along the corridor leading to Gates 13-22

reviews.content: Very nice quiet lounge, lots of comfy seating, good food and exceptional service.

The main differences between business and first class lounges are:
-Less crowded
-table service dining
-premium alcohol (ie JW blue, Remy XO, etc

This is consistent with the BA First lounge in T3.
It's average, just like its business class lounge.
Lounge is overall very well done. Bar area seating is a little disappointing only because power outlets (for US plugs) weren't all working.

Of course a high scale lounge with seated dining. The champagne bar is posh tho only serving Henriot Brut and Rose. Style is British decent and backward compared to the Cathay Lounge. Impressive cake.

By far one of the top two lounges at LHR (next to Virgin) the multiple, very nicely upholstered areas are quiet, comfortable, modern. Separate champagne bar is a unique touch. Food is fresher than AA.
Quieter than the biz lounge but definitely not a First Class lounge. Food to order is disgusting, better to take from buffet. Bathrooms are worse than the public ones at LHR. Good champagne though...
I would expect a bit more from a First Class lounge. Interior and furniture looks a bit run down. Selection of food and drinks is ok, but not impressive. It's a quiet lounge though.

This lounge is dated, dark, dirty, lacks power. Yes the food is ok & there is Tattinger and Blue Label but I am very unimpressed & surprised. Are reviewers confusing this with T5's exceptional lounge?
Nice but I know better business class lounges. Not worth the ginormous price tag of BA F-class, though a definite improvement from the business class counterpart.
Great space, oneworld Emerald status can dine in restaurant before 6pm as well as the buffet.
The best lounge. Breakfast to order.
A very nice lounge, but I wouldn't say one of the best in the world.  The food and beverage selection was fairly limited.  And the check-in lady was snooty and not very welcoming.
Large, quiet lounge with decent food including a sit down restaurant. Good sized business centre, large selection of alcohol (including premium champagne) and a travel spa. Worth a visit.
Best lounge I've ever been to. Spacious, great alcohol selection, quiet. Even has its own private restaurant inside.
Overall not a bad lounge. Looking a bit dated. Selection of drinks are top shelf. Food is good too.
Great food and drink selection, and an amazing array of magazines and newspapers. Rarely crowded too. Hard to beat.
This is a great, large lounge with excellent food, fantastic champagne, and quiet spots.
This is a solid First Class lounge with a good bar. Though it's often crowded with limited seating and spotty internet, it's still better than the Business Class lounges at LHR.
This is truly one of the top lounges in the world. Here, you can find an exceptional bar, great selection of food, and unmatched comfort and design.

location.terminalDirections: Departure Level, after Duty Free, Lounge Area H
Exit to the right after the Terminal 3 Customs Hall, take the stairs or lift to Level 2.

otherLounges.name: American Airlines International First Class Lounge

location.terminalDirections: After Passport Control, exit Duty Free Area and turn right toward Lounge Area H.
Zone F, located along the corridor leading to Gates 13-22.
Lounge C in the Central Concourse, near Gate 11.
Lounge C in the Central Concourse, near Gate 11.
Located near Gate 9, lounge is signposted as "Lounge D" on the right hand side.
Follow the signs to 'Lounge F' towards Gates 13-22, proceed up one level via the lift or stairs.

The Lounge is in Terminal 3 Area A. After you go through security, follow Flight Connection route Area A,  access point in the main shopping and dining area to Level 2 accessible by taking the elevators.
Zone E, Level 1, along corridor with Gates 1-11
Zone B, located in the Central Concourse, near Gate 11, next to the Cathay Pacific Lounge.
Located in the Upper Class Wing.
5 minute walk from customs, just off the Arrivals Hall
